title: DEER Quick Model
description: Schema for model input data for DEER Quick Model

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: The name of the building or project

enum: DEER Pre-1975
DEER 1985
DEER 1996
DEER 2003
DEER 2007
DEER 2011
DEER 2014
DEER 2015
DEER 2017
template.title: Target Standard

floor_height.title: Typical Floor to FLoor Height
floor_height.description: Selecting a typical floor height of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

building_rotation.title: Building Rotation
building_rotation.description: Set Building Rotation off of North (positive value is clockwise). Rotation applied after geometry generation. Values greater than +/- 45 will result in aspect ratio and party wall orientations that do not match cardinal directions of the inputs.

ns_to_ew_ratio.title: Ratio of North/South Facade Length Relative to East/West Facade Length
ns_to_ew_ratio.description: Selecting an aspect ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. Aspect ratios less than one are not recommended for sliced bar geometry, instead rotate building and use a greater than 1 aspect ratio.

perim_mult.title: Perimeter Multiplier
perim_mult.description: Selecting a value of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. This represents a multiplier for the building perimeter relative to the perimeter of a rectangular building that meets the area and aspect ratio inputs. Other than the smart default of 0.0 this argument should have a value of 1.0 or higher and is only applicable Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced division method.

wwr.title: Window to Wall Ratio
wwr.description: Selecting a window to wall ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

system_type.title: HVAC System Type
system_type.default: VAV district chilled water with district hot water reheat

enum: NaturalGas
Electricity
HeatPump
swh_src.title: Service Water Heating Source
swh_src.description: The primary source of heating used by SWH systems in the model.

enum: None
Largest Zone
Adjacent
kitchen_makeup.title: Kitchen Exhaust MakeUp Air Calculation Method
kitchen_makeup.description: Determine logic to identify dining or cafe zones to provide makeup air to kitchen exhaust.

enum: 0 - Undeveloped Areas Parks
1 - Developed Areas Parks
2 - Neighborhood
3 - All Other Areas
4 - High Activity
exterior_lighting_zone.title: Exterior Lighting Zone
exterior_lighting_zone.description: Identify the Exterior Lighting Zone for the Building Site.

onsite_parking_fraction.title: Onsite Parking Fraction
onsite_parking_fraction.description: If set to 0 no exterior lighting for parking will be added

modify_wkdy_op_hrs.title: Modify weekday hours of operation
modify_wkdy_op_hrs.description: Modify the weekday hours of operation in the model.

wkdy_op_hrs_start_time.title: Weekday Operating Hours Start Time
wkdy_op_hrs_start_time.description: Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm. Only used if Modify weekday hours of operation is true.

wkdy_op_hrs_duration.title: Weekday Operating Hours Duration
wkdy_op_hrs_duration.description: Length of weekday operating hours. Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm. Only used if Modify weekday hours of operation is true.

modify_wknd_op_hrs.title: Modify weekend hours of operation
modify_wknd_op_hrs.description: Modify the weekend hours of operation in the model.

wknd_op_hrs_start_time.title: Weekend Operating Hours Start Time
wknd_op_hrs_start_time.description: Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm.  Only used if Modify weekend hours of operation is true.

wknd_op_hrs_duration.title: Weekend Operating Hours Duration
wknd_op_hrs_duration.description: Length of weekend operating hours. Enter 24 hour values with fractional values converted to minutes. e.g. 17.25 = 5:15pm.  Only used if Modify weekend hours of operation is true.

unmet_hours_tolerance.title: Unmet Hours Tolerance
unmet_hours_tolerance.description: Set the thermostat setpoint tolerance for unmet hours in degrees Rankine

enum: Option D
Option E
sce_rate_type.title: SCE Electric Rate Option
sce_rate_type.description: Option D is used for buildings with Load Factor > 0.4, Otherwise choose Option E. The actual tariff used will depend on the building's peak load.

om_cost.title: Baseline Annual Operation and Maintenance Costs
om_cost.description: For Life-Cycle Cost Comparisons: Enter the baseline annual operation and maintenance costs (in USD) of the existing building. These costs should be for features thaat will be upgraded/replaced in the alternative analysis, and will be removed by the alternatives to create a Life-Cycle cost comparison.

replacement_cost.title: Baseline Replacement Costs
replacement_cost.description: For Life-Cycle Cost Comparisons: Enter the replacement cost (in USD) of the baseline equipment with like equipment (i.e. NOT upgrade equipment), if the replacement is expected within the LCCA study period (25 years).

remaining_life.title: Remaining Life of Equipment to be Replaced
remaining_life.description: For Life-Cycle Cost Comparisons: Enter the remaining life (whole years) of the equipment to be upgraded. Enter 0 if equipment is assumed to be end-of life. This is the period from the start of the study period that the Replacement Cost above will be realized.
